name: Structural pseudo-class
description: This pseudo-classes are so called **structural pseudo-classes** and selects based on the document tree but cannot be represented by other simple selectors. The index numbering starts at 1.

sub_selectors.name: Root
sub_selectors.description: The `:root` pseudo-class matches the root element of a document. In HTML documents this is always the `<html>` element.
sub_selectors.example_description: In this example the root element `<html>` will get a gray `background-color`.

sub_selectors.name: Empty
sub_selectors.description: The `:empty` pseudo-class matches any element that has no children. So its data length is greater than 0 whereas comments and processing instructions elements are ignored.
sub_selectors.example_description: Here, in this example, all empty elements will have a red, solid border.

sub_selectors.name: Last-Child
sub_selectors.description:
The `:last-child` pseudo-class will match the last child element of of its parent element. It's also the same as `:nth-last-child(1)`.
[info]This pseudo-class is part of the CSS3 specification while its "opposite" selector [`:first-child`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css2/structural-pseudo-class/ 'CSS2: Structural pseudo class') is part of CSS2.[/info]
sub_selectors.example_description: This example code will select just the last element in the list of children of its parent element.

sub_selectors.name: Only-Child
sub_selectors.description: The `:only-child` pseudo-class will select only elements which are the only child of its parent (element) and has no other children element(s). It's the same as `:first-child:last-child`.
sub_selectors.example_description: Every child node which is the only child of its parent will have a gray `background-color`.

sub_selectors.name: First-Of-Type
sub_selectors.description: The `:first-of-type` pseudo-class is going to match the first element of the (optionally specified) type. It's also the same as `:nth-of-type(1)`.
sub_selectors.example_description: This example code will select just the first `<span>` element in the list of children of its parent element and give it a gray background.

sub_selectors.name: Last-Of-Type
sub_selectors.description: The `:last-of-type` pseudo-class is the opposite of [`:first-of-type`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css3/structural-pseudo-class/#first-of-type-class 'CSS3: Structural pseudo class') and is going to match the last element of the (optionally specified) type. It's also the same as `:nth-last-of-type(1)`.
sub_selectors.example_description: This example code will select only the last `<span>` element of its parent element and give it a gray background.

sub_selectors.name: Only-Of-Type
sub_selectors.description: The `:only-of-type` pseudo-class is going to match only elements which are the only child elements of its type.
sub_selectors.example_description: This example is going to select only the first `<span>` and give it a gray background because it's the only element which is of that element type.

sub_selectors.name: Nth-Child
sub_selectors.description: The `:nth-child()` pseudo-class will first split the elements into groups of `a` elements and then select any child element that is the `b`th child.
sub_selectors.example_description:
This example will select every odd `

` and set a gray background.

sub_selectors.name: Nth-Last-Child
sub_selectors.description: The `:nth-last-child()` pseudo-class behaves like [`:nth-child`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css3/structural-pseudo-class/#nth-child-class 'CSS3: Structural pseudo class') but with the difference that the siblings after it in the document tree will be selected.
sub_selectors.example_description:
This example will select every even `

` and set a gray background.

sub_selectors.name: Nth-Of-Type
sub_selectors.description: The `:nth-of-type()` pseudo-class behaves like [`:nth-child`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css3/structural-pseudo-class/#nth-child-class 'CSS3: Structural pseudo class') but with the difference that only elements with the same element name will be selected.
sub_selectors.example_description:
This example will select every odd only `

` element and set a gray background.

sub_selectors.name: Nth-Last-Of-Type
sub_selectors.description: The `:nth-of-type()` pseudo-class behaves like [`:nth-of-type`](https://css4-selectors.com/selector/css3/structural-pseudo-class/#nth-of-type-class 'CSS3: Structural pseudo class') but with the difference that the specified element siblings after it in the document tree will be selected.
sub_selectors.example_description:
This example will select every even only `

` element and set a gray background.
